meanings.definition: The man-made features in a landscape, such as paths or walls.
meanings.sent1: The hardscape of the park included stone benches and concrete walkways.
meanings.sent2: The designer incorporated various hardscape elements like fountains and sculptures in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel used the stone wall as a hardscape for its acorn storage, thinking it was a secret hideout.
meanings.sent4: The hardscape of the city seemed to reflect its industrial history, with metal structures jutting out everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The hardscape of the playground was so colorful and inviting that children couldn't resist exploring every corner.

meanings.definition: To create or add man-made features to a landscape.
meanings.sent1: The landscaping company was hired to hardscape the backyard with a new patio and retaining wall.
meanings.sent2: She decided to hardscape her front yard by installing a decorative pathway and flower beds.
meanings.sent3: The neighbors were surprised to see him hardscape his garden overnight, turning it into a mini oasis.
meanings.sent4: His passion for gardening led him to hardscape every inch of his property, transforming it into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The team worked tirelessly to hardscape the public park, adding benches and pergolas to enhance the space.
